meanings.definition: To move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The cat sprang onto the table when it saw a mouse.
meanings.sent2: She sprang out of bed when she heard the alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel sprang up the tree to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: His heart sprang with joy when he saw his long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The idea suddenly sprang into her mind like a bolt of lightning.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she sprang over the hurdle effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: He sprang up from his chair when he realized he was late.
meanings.sent3: The ballerina sprang across the stage with grace and poise.
meanings.sent4: The news of the victory sprang a smile on his face.
meanings.sent5: The memory of their childhood friendship sprang vividly to mind.

meanings.sent1: The kangaroo's powerful sprang surprised the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: With a sudden sprang, the cat caught the elusive butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The clown's sprang made the children burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The sprang of the athlete was so high, it broke a record.
meanings.sent5: The sprang of the jack-in-the-box always startles me.
